intro: Robbairea akkensis, commonly known as the Akkens rock rose, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of northern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers, which range from pink to red, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
